paper_abstract: The combination of formal power series and appropriate summability methods is considered for the inversion of the non-linear, distributed-parameter model of a boundary controlled tubular reactor. The inversion is performed in order to realize the tracking of certain prescribed output trajectories in open-loop control. Simulation results illustrate the applicability of the design approach for the example of finite-time transitions between set-points for a tubular bioreactor.
paper_title: Model inversion of boundary controlled parabolic partial differential equations using summability methods
